fr.xephi.authme.security.crypts

Class UnsaltedMethod

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.xephi.authme.security.crypts.UnsaltedMethod
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EncryptionMethod
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Argon2, CmwCrypt, DoubleMd5, Md5, RoyalAuth, Sha1, Sha512, TwoFactor, Whirlpool, Wordpress

    public abstract class UnsaltedMethod
extends Object
implements EncryptionMethod
    Common type for encryption methods which do not use any salt whatsoever.

      • comparePassword

        public boolean comparePassword(String password,
                               HashedPassword hashedPassword,
                               String name)
        Description copied from interface: EncryptionMethod
        Check whether the given hash matches the clear-text password.
        Specified by:
        comparePassword in interface EncryptionMethod
        Parameters:
        password - The clear-text password to verify
        hashedPassword - The hash to check the password against
        name - The player name to do the check for (sometimes required for generating the salt)
        Returns:
        True if the password matches, false otherwise

      • generateSalt

        public String generateSalt()
        Description copied from interface: EncryptionMethod
        Generate a new salt to hash a password with.
        Specified by:
        generateSalt in interface EncryptionMethod
        Returns:
        The generated salt, null if the method does not use a random text-based salt

      • hasSeparateSalt

        public boolean hasSeparateSalt()
        Description copied from interface: EncryptionMethod
        Return whether the encryption method requires the salt to be stored separately and passed again to EncryptionMethod.comparePassword(String, HashedPassword, String). Note that an encryption method returning false does not imply that it uses no salt; it may be embedded into the hash or it may use the username as salt.
        Specified by:
        hasSeparateSalt in interface EncryptionMethod
        Returns:
        True if the salt has to be stored and retrieved separately, false otherwise
